snippet: The city still can’t seem to deal with voting in the computer age, and the problems go well beyond counting.
abstract: Editorial criticizes New York City's Board of Elections for running a slow, often loony system that cannot seem to deal with voting in the computer age; offers suggestions for fixing the system, including changing the way election staff are hired and trained, how board members are chosen, and a streamlining of the voting process.
lead_paragraph: The city still can’t seem to deal with voting in the computer age, and the problems go well beyond counting.

headline.main: Mismanaging the Vote in New York City
